accuracy.description: The correctness of the answers provided by the agent in relation to the input questions.

accepted_values.high: The answer is correct and fully addresses the question.
accepted_values.medium: The answer is partially correct with some missing or slightly incorrect information.
accepted_values.low: The answer has significant inaccuracies or irrelevant to the question.
accepted_values.none: The answer is completely incorrect or no answer is provided.

completeness.description: The extent to which the agent's response fully addresses all parts of the task.

accepted_values.complete: All steps of the task have been successfully executed and all parts of the question have been addressed.
accepted_values.partial: Some steps of the task have been successfully executed, but not all parts of the question have been addressed.
accepted_values.incomplete: Few or none of the steps have been successfully executed, leaving the question largely unaddressed.

reasoning_traceability.description: The capacity to follow the agent's logical reasoning process throughout the task.

accepted_values.traceable: The reasoning process is clear, logical, and well-documented.
accepted_values.somewhat_traceable: The reasoning process is somewhat clear but may lack detailed documentation.
accepted_values.untraceable: The reasoning process is unclear and not documented, making it hard to follow.

internet_dependency.description: The extent to which the agent relies on internet sources for completing the task.

accepted_values.independent: The agent operates without using direct internet sources, relying on its own knowledge base.
accepted_values.limited_dependency: The agent uses internet sources when necessary but attempts to rely on its own knowledge base.
accepted_values.dependent: The agent heavily relies on internet sources for information to complete the task.

originality.description: The degree of novelty in the agent's answers, ensuring they are not copied directly from existing sources.

accepted_values.high_or_novel: The answers are unique and show independent thought or synthesis.
accepted_values.medium: The answers contain some original components combined with sourced information.
accepted_values.low: The answers are largely sourced from existing content with little to no modification.

efficiency.description: The speed and resource utilization of the agent while performing the task.

accepted_values.high: The agent completes the task quickly and uses resources optimally.
accepted_values.medium: The agent completes the task in a reasonable time with acceptable resource usage.
accepted_values.low: The agent takes a long time to complete the task and/or uses resources poorly.

adaptability.description: The ability of the agent to handle various types of questions and adapt its approach if necessary.

accepted_values.high: The agent successfully handles a wide range of question types and can adapt when faced with obstacles.
accepted_values.medium: The agent handles common question types well but struggles with unique or complex scenarios.
accepted_values.low: The agent has difficulty with anything beyond basic questions and shows little adaptability.
